abstract: If Citigroup backs out of its marketing deal with the Mets, will it escape the stadium-naming jinx?
snippet: If Citigroup backs out of its marketing deal with the Mets, will it escape the stadium-naming jinx?
lead_paragraph: Citigroup is considering backing out of a $400 million marketing deal with the New York Mets, according to The Wall Street Journal. (Citigroup disputes this report, though.) If the beleaguered company does pull out, it would lose the naming rights to the Mets’ new stadium.
